description:
Erection of single storey rear extension; with basement excavation; part
front extension with associated elevational changes; removal of residential use on site (C3), with sole use of building as synagogue and Mikve (Use Class F1 (f))
subdivision_of_building:
Building ref:

1 Fairholt

Max Height

9m

No. of storeys

3
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The development
hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance
with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of
details. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>

</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">REASON: To
ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance
with the plans hereby approved.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">No development
shall take place until a detailed Demolition and Construction Management Plan
covering the matters set out below has been submitted to and approved in
writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall only be
implemented in accordance with the details and measures approved as part of the
demolition and construction management plan, which shall be maintained
throughout the entire construction period. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:36.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">a)
A demolition and construction method statement covering all phases of the
development to include details of noise control measures and measures to
preserve air quality (including a risk assessment of the demolition and
construction phase) and details of dust mitigation measures during site
clearance and construction works (including any works of demolition of existing
buildings or breaking out or crushing of concrete); <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:36.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">b)
A demolition and construction traffic management plan to include the following:
the construction programme/ timescales; the number/ frequency and size of
construction vehicles; construction traffic route; location of 2 deliveries;
pedestrian and vehicular access arrangements; any temporary road/ footway
closures during the construction period; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:36.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">c)
A demolition and construction waste management plan setting out how resources
will be managed and waste controlled at all stages during the construction
project; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>







</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">REASON: To
avoid hazard and obstruction being caused to users of the public highway and in
the interest of public safety and amenity. The condition is required to be
discharged prior to the commencement of the development as uncontrolled
demolition and construction could be prejudicial to highway safety and the
amenities of neighbouring occupiers.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">Before the
start of the relevant part of the works, proposals for any structural works
shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority
and shall be carried out accordingly. The required detail is the submission of
a detailed report and method statement by a suitably qualified and experienced
chartered structural engineer, addressing the following areas: <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-indent:36.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">a)
Detailing the engineer’s qualifications, relevant experience and supervisory
role; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-indent:36.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">b)
Explaining how the existing structure stands; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:36.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">c)
Detailing the method by which the existing structure is to be supported and
protected during the works so as to ensure the structural stability and
integrity of all the elements which are to be retained (the temporary works); <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:36.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">d)
Confirming how damage to the building or surrounding buildings and structures
will be avoided and how the safety and stability of the historic building
fabric will be ensured; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:36.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">e)
Detailing the structural interventions to ensure that the building will stand
in the future, including details (for example and not limited to) of any new
foundation design, underpinning, steelwork and other strengthening and their
locations and methods of fixing and installation, with sketches as necessary
(the permanent works). <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:36.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">All
excavation and structural works shall be carried out strictly in accordance
with the details so approved and not otherwise. All excavation and structural
works shall be carried out by hand. No other excavation or structural works are
authorised by this consent without prior approval of the details. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>













<span style="font-size:11.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:Aptos;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA">REASON: To ensure
that special regard is paid to protecting the retained fabric of the
building.&nbsp;</span><br></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">Notwithstanding
the details shown on the plans and documents hereby approved detailed
drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set
out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in
writing, before any work is commenced. The development shall not be carried out
otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;- a biodiverse, substrate-based extensive
green/brown roof (of variable depth between 80mm and 150mm), including a
detailed maintenance plan <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>



</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">REASON: To
enhance the character and ecology of the development, to provide undisturbed
refuges for wildlife, to promote sustainable urban drainage, to enhance the
performance and efficiency of the proposed building and assists in the meeting
the Local Development Framework Core Strategy objective of reducing carbon
emissions.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Prior
to the first occupation of each building or part of a building or use, a
'Secured by Design' accreditation shall be obtained for such building or part
of such building or use and thereafter all features are to be permanently
retained.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p>

</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">REASON:
To reduce levels of crime.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p>Land Contamination</p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">a)
A preliminary risk assessment which identifies all previous uses, potential
contaminants associated with those uses (including asbestos, landfill gas,
vapours and ground water contaminants); a conceptual model of the site
indicating sources, pathways and receptors; and potentially unacceptable risks
arising from contamination at the site;</span><span style="font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm"><span style="white-space-collapse: preserve;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;b) A generic and detailed
quantitative risk assessment based on (a) that identifies the risk to all
receptors potentially affected, including those off site;&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm"><span style="white-space-collapse: preserve;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">c) In the event that remediation
measures are deemed necessary following the results of (b), an options
appraisal identifying feasible remediation options, detailing evaluation of
options, and selecting the most appropriate remediation option(s);&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm"><span style="white-space-collapse: preserve;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">d) A remediation strategy focused
on the remediation option(s) selected in (c) setting site specific monitoring
objectives and criteria, providing details of monitoring and maintenance, and
containing full details of the remediation measures required, and how they are
to be undertaken.&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm"><span style="white-space-collapse: preserve;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">e) A verification plan explaining
how the effectiveness of the remediation works set out in (d) will be measured,
and how data will be collected and assessed to demonstrate that the remediation
objectives and criteria will be met.&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm"><span style="white-space-collapse: preserve;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">f) A verification report
demonstrating that remediation objectives and criteria identified in (e) have
been met, assessing the remediation performance, and creating a final record of
the land quality whilst providing a plan for long term monitoring and maintenance
(if required).&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm"><span style="white-space-collapse: preserve;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Any investigation and risk
assessment must be undertaken in strict accordance with the requirements of the
Environment Agency’s Land Contamination Risk Management (LCRM).&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm"><span style="white-space-collapse: preserve;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">If additional significant
contamination is found at any time when carrying out the approved development,
it must immediately be reported in writing to the LPA.&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p>

















<span style="white-space-collapse: preserve;"></span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;
font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;color:black">REASON: To protect human health and
the environment by ensuring no harm is caused by land contamination, in line
with paragraphs H, I and J, LP 58 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 and the
Hackney contaminated land strategy 2022/2030.&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The premises
shall be used as a synagogue and for no other purposes, including any other
purpose in Class F1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Uses
Classes) Order 1987 or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any
statutory instrument revoking and re- enacting that Order. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>

</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">REASON: In
granting this permission, the Council has had regard to the special
circumstances of this case and to the policies contained in the prevailing
Development Plan, and consider that planning permission would have been refused
for unrestricted use within Class F1 of the Use Classes Order.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The
development hereby approved shall be carried out in strict adherence to the
Operational Management Plan (OMP) prepared by John Stebbing Architects dated 6
February 2024 (Rev A).&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p>

</p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The applicant shall notify the local planning authority of any
subsequent changes to this OMP so that it can assess any impacts that these
changes may have on the residential amenity of local residents or on the
performance of the local highway network.&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.5pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">REASON: In
the interests of the protection of residential amenity and the performance of
the local highway network.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p>Details shall be submitted to the local planning authority for written approval showing the type and location of swift boxes / tiles and bat boxes / tiles to be incorporated into the development hereby approved.&nbsp; The approved scheme of details shall subsequently be incorporated into the development prior to first occupation.</p><p>REASON:&nbsp; In the interests of the promotion of biodiversity net gain for the site.</p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">Full details of the materials to be used on the external surfaces of the
development, including glazing, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local
Planning Authority in writing before any work proceeds beyond damp proof
course. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance
with the details thus approved. The submitted details should include bricks and
not brick slips. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>

</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">REASON: To
ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does
not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">Detailed
drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set
out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in
writing, before any work proceeds beyond damp proof course. The development
shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus
approved. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">a) Details of
windows and doors, including reveals.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">b) Details of
cycle storage, including stand sizes and spacing (Cycle parking plan).&nbsp; The cycle storage shall be installed prior to
the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>





</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">REASON: To
ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does
not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area, and to ensure
adequate provision of cycle storage.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p>The noise level from all plant and machinery included in the approved development and all other noise generating activities in the building, including singing, shall at all times remain&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: &quot;PT Sans&quot;, sans-serif;">10dB(A) below background levels when measured at any nearby residential window&nbsp;</span>or other sensitive receptor.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that occupiers of neighbouring premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance and other excess noise.<br></p>
